Banking was conceived in iniquity and was born in sin. The bankers own the earth. Take it away from them, but leave them the power to create money, and with the flick of the pen they will create enough deposits to buy it back again. 
However, take away from them the power to create money and all the great fortunes like mine will disappear and they ought to disappear, for this would be a happier and better world to live in. 
But, if you wish to remain the slaves of bankers and pay the cost of your own slavery, let them continue to create money.

Josiah Charles Stamp

One of my favorite games and shooters, Half-Life 2 totally expanded on the first game with bigger environments, new sets of enemies (some of which are totally terrifying) and real-time cutscenes.

A very balanced and fun single player adventure, back when your character's health bar wouldn't refill automatically after a small amount of time (which was not all that long ago).

They totally need to make Episode 3 (as promised for long ago) or Half-Life 3 AND keep that style of gameplay, while introducing new ideas of course.

A masterful piece of storytelling and technology, possibly the most advanced game of the time. It’s hard to find fault in this game, but then again you can find many faults, depending on how you look at it. Either way, you can’t deny the fact that this is in fact one of the greatest first-person shooters of all-time. 10/10

Infinitamente superior al Halflife 1 en cuanto a gráficos, pero igual de largo y lineal. El juego se limita a dispara y corre, de hecho hay zonas que las puedes pasar simplemente corriendo sin necesidad de matar a los enemigos. No tienen ninguna trama ni historia de interés, ni desafío más allá de encontrar a veces la salida de una zona. Tal vez en su época fuera muy bueno pero ahora mismo (2013) no se merece el 97 de puntuación de Metacritic. Puntuación: 5.

This game is perfect in almost every way. The story is fantastic, the characters are actually believable, the gameplay is fast-paced and fun, all the weapons are satisfying to use (and believe me, you WILL have used them all at least once by the time you finish the game), and the atmosphere will suck you right in to the adventure (the Ravenholm level is actually genuinly frightening in places). My only real complaint with Half-Life 2 is that the gravity gun could have been put to better use throughout the game.....although it does get a nice little upgrade during the last part of the game...

All in all, Half-Life 2 is a must-have for any fan of story-driven FPS's.
Grandioso juego y exelente historia, vale la pena jugarlo, exelente trabajo valve :)

Half Life получила свою популярность в первую очередь благодаря модификациям, такими как: Counter-Strike, Team Fortress и Day of Defeat. Как по мне, первая часть была очень сырой: да, не спорю графика была чуть ли не самой лучшей для тех лет, даже была какая-то физика объектов, но в плане геймплея она проигрывала Quake 2, вышедшей годом ранее. Сюжетной нагрузки, наверно, 20% от всей игры, все настолько размыто, что ни чего не возможно понять. В принципе, Valve и не рассчитывала на успех, по-этому и выкинули то, что было и не заморачивались с сюжетом, но с выходом второй части все изменилось... Реалистичная графика, физика, мимика лиц - все это поражало воображение. Наконец, она рассказала нам многое о самой игровой вселенной, но множество тайн еще предстоит открыть, как сообществу, так и самим разработчикам.

Oyunu tavsiye ediyorum çünkü;

+ Muhteşem grafikler
+ Muhteşem oynanış
+ Muhteşem senaryo
+ Muhteşem müzikler
+ Alyx gibi bir karakter
+ Vuruş hissi ve silah tokluğu olması gerektiği gibi
+ Source motorunun gücü arkasında
+ Eski Half-Life tarzını koruyor

- Yok, en azından ben bulamadım

Half-Life 2 takes a minimilist approach to story development, but delivers a rich, atmospheric, and engaging world that sucks you right in. Combined with novel gameplay elemetns (one of the first mainstream games to make proper use of physics in gameplay), an ensemble of likeable characters—topped off with the much loved Alyx Vance, and well paced combat, this helps to make Half-Life 2 an all-time classic.

The critics are right. This is the top classic of the gaming, and we're talking about J.r.r Tolkien Lord of the Rings level of classism here. Everything you want from a shooter (except fancy graphics but there's a way to fix that problem), it's in here. And it runs smoothly on any kind of "machine", from supercomputers to toasters.

Half Life 2 brilliantly combines intense combat, constantly evolving and sensible storyline and puzzling. Sometimes these are separated, sometimes not, sometimes you really have to turn on your multitasking centers and do everything simultaneously. It's just bloody brilliant. No more hiding behind blocks just to advance. The map usually provides you many tools aside from your weapons you'll gather over time as the story progresses (how does he carry so many weapons?!), which should make your task of fighting through hordes of Combine (alien) or Civil protection units. This is needed, especially at harder difficulties. The AI is surprisingly smart at the times, whether it's enemy or an ally (Yes! you can command your own squad at certain points of the game) so sometimes, rushing in and imagining yourself as bulletproof Chuck Norris doesn't always help

The only gripe with this game is similar to what World of Warcraft suffers: Outdated graphics. But if you're looking for a good gaming experience, Half Life 2 is for you

By the way, you can install Cinematic Mod 2013 for Half  Life 2 if you're looking to VASTLY improve your graphics and replace rather cheecy and periodic music to something much more... epic. Doing this can be tricky and might take some time and nerves, especially for a new modder, like me.

If you feel you want to immerse yourself in the universe of Half Life, you should definitely buy the other episodes too and check for Half Life timelines from the internet. And here's a final easter egg: Portal franchise's storyline is connected to Half Life

For every gamer: Half Life 2 (and the rest of its episodes)

I recommend to try out all Half Life Series, since they are all connected together in a very amusing story and gameplay you might not want to miss out regretfully. Shooting opponents can do in every killing-game. However there are still some games out there (Like H-L series), that do contain little puzzles, tricks and more things to be accomplished before you can proceed. Here are the key-features i especially like:
- Source; Physics and Gravity comparing to reallife's earth. I have seen nowhere better technology than on this one yet (2013)
- A new weapon, which many do prefer: The Zero Point Energy Field Manipulator.
- Masterwork of a story and actions.
- GAME OF THE YEAR 2004 AWARD! Surprise!

You are Gordon Freeman, you have been in a state of stasis since you defeated the xenian responsible for keeping a portal open letting alien creatures flood into earth. You are under "employment" by a mysterious figure known as the "g-man" yet that's about as much as you know about him. In the 10 or so years you have been gone earth has gone through a worldwide war where the alliances are Earth and the Combine, an advanced multi race empire that drove earth to surrender in just 7 hours. The earth is now a dystopia ruled with an iron grip by the Universal Union (combine). All citizens are oppressed by the visitors and children no longer exist, the combine are just waiting for all the humans to die off while they drain the planet of its resources. The problem is there is a growing rebellion against the combine which might just stop them from turning the world into a barren desert that once thrived. This is where you enter the game, and you are destined to be the silent saviour of mankind.

Half-Life 2 is a work of art. Released in 2004 this game is a masterpiece that changed and shook the gaming industry and is a prominent example of a must play video game. The game was an amazing feat of video game creation at the time of it's release. The graphics were amazing and they still hold up well against the test of time, and core mechanics of this game had yet to be used on any game before this one. The game offers a seamless story telling narritive that doesn't hop you into a dull cutscene instead it puts you straight into it as part of the scene as opposed to a ghostly observer that happens to possess the protagonist when it's time to play the game, You are in the game. The game is never been interupted by a conventional loading screen, something that plagues the gaming world and makes gamers dread their gaming for a moment (I'm looking at GTA online or a bethesda RPG title) instead you'll have a very brief load box where the next area is loaded and the old one is removed from your game world (though it doesn't feel like anythings gone0 as if you just autosaved in another game. The game stays fresh with constant changes of scene and puzzles to mix up the first person shooter formula. This game doesn't feel like a mindless shooter campaign against lifeless multiplayer assets, instead its a nice enjoyable world to immerse yourself in. 

Half-Life 2 needs to be in your library if you plan on having the steam platform on your computer. It's worth every penny and Its honestly a steal for how much it costs

It feels rather weird to "recommend" Half-Life 2. The game has been around for years, all words have already been said, articles written, awards received. The game is very famous, it has become a part of global mass culture, and it would be really hard to find someone who had never heard of it, at least. Still, I've got a habit to write a couple of words about games I've played, and there's no reason for this one to be an exclusion.

So, this is half a shooter, half a puzzle. You are supposed to use not only your guns, but also your brains, and that is most probably the reason why it's been a hit. I can also see how the game defined the shape of future shooters that appeared after it. I can now understand why it's always been considered as classic.

It's tough, and it demands concentration. It's not just having fun, it's surviving (by the way, I am totally sure that a normal living person could not have possibly survived all that story). No matter how often you save the game, it's always not often enough. In some of its episodes this game can be badly annoying and irritating, making you want to catch one of those metrocops or soldiers by his throat and punch, punch, punch his face until there's nothing to punch. (Well, maybe I'm exaggerating a bit.)

Solid product; challenging, involving, lengthy (it took me 20 hours to complete it). Nice companion girl included.

Half-Life 2 é um FPS e Sci-Fi que com certeza veio para marcar uma era de jogos. Tal jogo tem um potencial absurdamente alto e explorado à grandes faixas. Nada é deixado de lado e tudo que envolve o jogo, como universo muito bem estabelecido e personagens carismáticos e marcantes são devidamente colocados à prova e mostrando seu real 'poder'. Talvez seja a melhor série de jogos criadas na história.

Sua história define-se em apenas uma palavra: Perfeição. Totalmente imersiva e intrigante, e outras qualidades para uma boa trama se desenrolar perfeitamente. Há muito pouco que possa se falar sem dar nenhum spoiler, mas é de longe uma das melhores se não a melhor história acompanhada de um excelente enredo da história dos jogos.

Você é Gordon Freeman, um cientista que trabalhava na Black Mesa, e após uma catástrofe se tornou um tipo de semi-deus. Não por causa de poderes ou algo do tipo, simplesmente pelo potencial de destruição que esse homem possui. "Like Chuck Norris in a geek form".

Sua ação é constante e faz com que cada minuto jogado seja melhor que o anterior. Apenas experimentando todo o jogo para realmente sentir o que Half-Life é capaz de proporcionar. 

Seu universo ligado com o de outro jogo da mesma empresa, Portal, e esse é um dos maiores pontos positivos do jogo. Além de já ser possuidor de uma história maravilhosa ele une com outro jogo de uma história de calibre semelhante. Apesar de não ser totalmente estampado isso, em algumas partes específicas você será capaz de perceber tal fato, claro que apenas se você já jogou algum jogo da série Portal.

What can I say other than this is the finest first person shooter I have ever played.  Before this, the only shooter I could call best was Half-Life and only Half-Life 2 was able to out match it.  I have never seen a shooter designed around the more classical mechanics of a shooter ever out match Half Life 2.  They always have to add limitations, strategy, incorporate other genres, or add realism to compete.  They can never do as Half-Life 2 did and push that little button on the back of your head which is excited by the violence, danger, and anxiety to the point of exhaustion.  There has never been a shooter which takes the mechanics from the 90's, polishes them up for modernity, and serves them out like Half Life 2 did.  I want to see a game which can do as well as it can, I want to play a game which can take the shooter genre as far as it did.  None ever have, and I don't know if I should call myself fortunate or not for having played this game.

The concept starts as so many have, it has become trite.  You are in an alien controlled distopia and are awoken to overthrow the interdimentional overlords and free the Earth from its vast empire.  The game was designed more as a sandbox filled with set pieces to show off the Source Engine and Havoc physics.  Valve could have stopped there, but brought with it a memorable experience which I have never seen topped.  The characters are memorable and the sights are unforgettable.  No matter how simple the beginnings, the journey is one which will find a place in your head and never leave you.

The physics, none can talk about the source engine without bringing up Havoc.  Grenades bounce, boxes, toilets, refrigerators, all fly around in the middle of explosions.  The singular weapon this game has been praised for, the gravity gun was designed to show off the engine.  It's a simple weapon where you pick up static objects and can either drop them or shoot them at things.

The guns are snappy and responsive, there are no iron sights, there is no two gun limitation, it's point and shoot while sprinting through levels watching your health deplete and listening to your adversaries scream at you.  The action is intense, the violence shocks you at first and never stops drilling into your brain.  The experience can be exhausting as your brain tracks enemies, explosions, ammo, guns, armor, health, all while bullets shoot at you or anxiety scratches the back of your neck over the next encounter.  Sometimes a physics puzzle stops your path, sometimes it's a banal distraction and a relaxing break from all the gunfire, sometimes it's more stress added to an already stressful encounter.  When I say exhausting, I do mean that.  I have found myself having to take breaks from the game just to let my mind unwind after a large and difficult encounter.

This doesn't even account on the moddability of the game, the amount of user created content created for this game available online and on steam as separate and free games (even though Valve can't be bothered to add workshop support).  Behind this game is an obsessive community in love with this product willing to make it more than it already is, for good or ill.  There is also a mostly dead multiplayer component, but every now and again - you may find people who want to do nothing more than throw toilets at each other with a gravity gun.

I'm rambling.  All I can say is this is the best First Person Shooter I've played.  Like it or hate it, if you have not experienced it, you can not say you are familiar with video games, and you definitely can not say you enjoy first person shooters.

Half Life 2 ist mit Abstand der beste Singleplayer-Shooter, den ich je gespielt oder gesehen habe. Von der ersten bis zur letzten Minute hat mich dieses Spiel in seinen Bann gezogen, was hauptsächlich durch die unglaublich dichte Atmosphäre und das sehr abwechslungsreiche Gameplay zustande kommt; während des gesamten Spiels wurde mir nie langweilig. Was einem hier geboten wird, sind keine einzelnen Missionen, sondern logisch miteinander verknüpfte Areale, die man zu Fuß oder mit verschiedenen Fahrzeugen durchquert, während man sich mit einer Vielzahl von coolen Waffen, wie der "Gravity-Gun", durch die Gegner durchkämpft.
Wer dieses Spiel noch nicht gespielt hat, der sollte das so schnell wie möglich nachholen, denn sonst verpasst er das Spiel, dass Maßstäbe für das Story-Shooter Genre gesetzt hat.
Schade ist nur, dass Gordon Freeman absolut stumm und als Charakter somit eher blass bleibt.
Und außerdem, wann zum Teufel bringt Valve endlich HALF-LIFE 3 raus?

Zerei quase 10 anos depois do lançamento, fico imaginando o que foi este jogo foi no seu lançamento, não é atoa que ganhou o prêmio de jogo do ano em 2004 e depois jogo da década. Half Life 2 foi um divisor de águas, a engine é muito inovadora para a época, é muito bacana interagir com a arma de gravidade nos objetos do cenário. O jogo foi muito bem dividido e de maneira nenhuma é enjoativo, os capítulos são bem variados entre a ação de tiroteio com muitos inimigos, clima de terror survive ambientação escura onde é necessário utilizar o cenário para enfrentar os alienígenas zumbis, pilotagem de veículos que eu achei muito divertido dentre outros, o jogo se aproveita de tudo o que essa engine pode oferecer. Não posso esquecer de citar o enredo do jogo, gostei muito da história e do universo Half Life, é bem interessante, até me fez querer saber mais da história na internet. Trilha sonora acompanha a grandiosidade, músicas muito bem adequadas em momentos certos. Percebi que esse jogo influenciou diversos outros que eu conheço. Enfins o que falar de um jogo que impressiona 10 anos depois.

Gra chociaż ma swoje lata, pokazuje prawdziwą potęgę silnika Source. Technologia jak na te czasy wspaniała, fabuła na bardzo wysokim poziomie i wysoki poziom trudności gry. Dodatkową wisienką na torcie jest ciekawe uzbrojenie oraz wymagający przeciwnicy. Pomimo niewinnego początku bardzo szybko rozgrywka zaczyna się rozkręcać i już w środku gry nie możemy liczyć na spokój od przeciwników. Wieczne uczucie obserwowania i setki przeciwników tworzą specyficzną atmosferę :) Polecam gorąco.
